Comments_List: Really got to develop my research skills from the hypothesis production phase all the way to collecting preliminary data!
Learned about research and developing a research project!
Great chance to get a jump on my thesis
A good way to earn credit by working in a Yale psychology lab.
I learned about many aspects of collecting data such as counterbalancing, designing a study, piloting, stimuli creation and collecting data.
I learned about research methods in this lab, including sitting in on SCIDs and learning how to conduct these interviews. I did a research project on emotion, and attended lab meetings as well.
Hands-on research experience in a psychology lab.
More guidance on the research project and writeup could improve this course.

The strengths are that it gives students an opportunity to see what research is like and see if it suits their academic interests. The weaknesses are that it has little structure, and it could be improved with more supervision.
Yes, this course is a wonderful way to become more immersed in various aspects of research while getting credit.
If you would rather receive credit than be paid for laboratory research, this is a good option.

I'd recommend this course to another student if the student already has their own project or a close working relationship with the mentor. Otherwise, it's easy for the student to not be given much work (or, as I've had in previous years, just have grad students give the student their busy work, like coding videos but not much else).
